page.title: 09Illston -The Fernie Hunt
page.content: Fox hunting still thrives in this area. The hunt meets twice a week on Wednesdays and Saturdays from October to March. The season begins with cubbing in which the hounds split the young cubs away from their family groups and so disperse the fox population throughout the area. The hunt is well supported and anything from 100 to 150 horses and riders usually take part. The kennels for the hounds are at Great Bowden and about 30 beagles (called 15 couples) usually take part in a hunt. Most of the hunting people are working farmers and their families. There is a growing concern about fox hunting and it is seen by some people to be a cruel blood sport. Some landowners will not allow the hunt on their property.
